subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: On PALM
msgSnippet: ... What were the very serious problems?  They look to me just like mandatory ligatures. -- John Cowan   cowan@ccil.org Mr. Lane, if you ever wish anything
messageBody:
Anthony Grahn scripsit:

> The first Shaw alphabet had separate letters for vowels + Roe just as
> you suggest but they introduce a whole new set of very serious
> problems. I'm certain this is why Read abandon them in QS. I think
> fixing Utter will fix the apparent problems with vowels + Roe and
> several other issues.

What were the very serious problems? They look to me just like mandatory
ligatures.

--
John Cowan cowan@...
"Mr. Lane, if you ever wish anything that I can do, all you will have
to do will be to send me a telegram asking and it will be done."
"Mr. Hearst, if you ever get a telegram from me asking you to do
anything, you can put the telegram down as a forgery."

> problems. I'm certain this is why Read abandon them in QS. I think

What were the very serious problems?  They look to me just like mandatory
